topic: Deep dive: plistlib standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: plistlib standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: plistlib Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This document provides a comprehensive overview of the plistlib module in Python 3.12+, focusing on its functionality, usage, and key features.
key_points: plistlib is a standard library in Python 3.12+ for working with Property List (plist) files
It supports reading and writing plists in XML and binary formats commonly used by Apple applications
plistlib provides an interface to work with key-value pairs, arrays, dictionaries, and other complex data structures present in plist files
Python 3.12+ adds support for reading and writing property list files using the new 'lzma' compression algorithm

code_examples.code:
import plistlib

# Reading a binary plist file
data = plistlib.readPlist('path/to/yourfile.plist')
print(data)

import plistlib

# Writing a binary plist file
data = {'key1': 'value1', 'key2': [1, 2, 3]}
plistlib.writePlist(data, 'path/to/outputfile.plist')

version_notes: Python 3.12+ introduces support for reading and writing plists with lzma compression
Previous versions of Python had limited support for plistlib, mostly focusing on XML-based plist files
caveats: plistlib does not natively support other binary plist formats such as those used by Android or Microsoft
When working with plists from Apple applications, ensure that the correct plist format is being used (XML or binary)
